snippet.title: Swimmer rushed to hospital in pool drama
snippet.content:
A 50-YEAR-OLD swimmer has been rushed to the Flinders Medical Centre after a "pool-related" incident. Emergency services were called to State Swim Seaford on Cascade Dr after reports of a possible drowning about 8pm on Thursday. The man, whose name has not been released, was given medical treatment before he was taken to hospital, where his condition was unknown. The State Swim Seaford, who operate swim lessons, was unavailable to provide any details on the incident. It was not clear if the man was a student or public customer.
A nine-year-old boy with autism is being hailed as a hero for saving a toddler from drowning in a pool full of other swimmers. CREDIT: 9Raw
Unrelated - autistic boy saves drowning child
